content:
I can imagine it was a bittersweet experience! It's great that you took the time to reflect on your collection and made the decision to let go of the DVDs that no longer brought you joy.

It's wonderful that you kept some of your favorite childhood movies, though! Those films hold a special place in our hearts, and it's lovely to have them as nostalgic reminders of happy times. "The Lion King" and "The Little Mermaid" are classics, and I'm sure they'll continue to bring a smile to your face whenever you watch them.

Letting go of physical objects can be tough, especially when they hold sentimental value. But it's also liberating to declutter and focus on what truly matters. You might find that you appreciate your remaining DVDs even more now that they're not buried among a large collection.

Did you consider digitizing your favorite childhood movies or keeping them in a special display case to preserve the memories?

(By the way, if you ever need any movie recommendations or have questions about a particular film, feel free to ask!)
